Tucson draws Talon closser to him in a tender embrace, and returns her kiss=
 as she had returned his.  He decided that true courtship was best kept for=
 when he could finally see her as he hoped to see her, with his own eyes.  =
Yet, at this moment he was very happy.  Just to have someone in his life wa=
s a gift enough for him.

" When I first came back online, I thought there =
may have been a power outage in the med bay.  Then I was told it was no los=
s of power.  The medics told me that the cranial shot I sustained was the c=
ulprit for my visual impairment and that they weren't positive, but thought=
 the damgage could be reversed.  After that, I recovered from other physica=
l damages, but got used to being blind.  Other senses compensated for that =
and I just accepted it for what it was.  Then an Autobot engineer came up w=
ith the idea of fitting me with a sonar system, and it worked.  I suppose I=
 won't be needing it anymore once the repairs are complete.  That's - if it=
 can be repaired."

He sighs.

" I knew it would take a long time, so I pro=
crastinated and things got out of hand during the wars against the predicon=
s and Decepticons, so I put that on hold for a while, until we found a mome=
nt of calm.  So much for that.  Now that Hydras and the Decepticons are at =
full force, and us with just a small handful of warriors, I fear that a ful=
l sense of calm won't be achieved.  It's up to Rodimus, Lord Elder and myse=
lf to get us to that point.  I know we can do it, and if I'm going to pull =
my weight in this war, I have to have all my senses online, including my si=
ght."

His crystal blue optics although dimmed, shimmer like aquamarines ag=
ainst the sun, as the light of the room catches them. Only until his sight =
is returned, would they once again be iluminated with the same light as the=
 optics of all the others.
